title: Person Raising Both Hands in Celebration

verbs: To shout an expression of excitement.
nouns: The act of expressing approval or admiration; commendation; laudation.
Praise is the act of making positive statements about a person, object or idea, either in public or privately.
Used to express approval, joy or victory.
A cheer; a cry of hurrah!.
A cheer; a cry of hurrah.
A victory cheer
That part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in primates (including humans).
The part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in a human, and the corresponding part in many other animals.
The zoological term for the distal portion of the forelimb of an animal (including the human hand)
Part of the fore limb.
The (prehensile) extremity of the superior limb
The manus is the zoological term for the distal portion of the fore limb of an animal.
A hand, as the part of the fore limb below the forearm in a man, or the corresponding part in other vertebrates.
A hand is a prehensile, multi-fingered extremity located at the end of an arm or forelimb of primates such as humans, chimpanzees, monkeys, and lemurs.
The use of movements, especially of the hands, to communicate familiar or prearranged signals
A gesture is a form of non-verbal communication or non-vocal communication in which visible bodily actions communicate particular messages, either in place of, or in conjunction with, speech.
Form of non-verbal communication or non-vocal communication
A quick movement of a finger or pen on a screen that the computer interprets as a command, rather than as a mouse movement, writing, or drawing.
The use of movements (especially of the hands) to communicate familiar or prearranged signals
The state of existing in something
The state or fact of existence, consciousness, or life, or something in such a state.
The state or quality of being being; existence.
The state of being, existing, or occurring; beinghood.
The state or fact of existing
Existence has been variously defined by sources.
The state of being, existing, or occurring.

description:
Two hands raised in the air, celebrating success or another joyous event.

Originally animated to show hands being raised, as might be done along with the the exclamation Banzai! in Japan. Now more commonly only shows the hands in the air.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the raising hands emoji features two hands lifted upwards with palms facing forward, bathed in soft, realistic lighting that gives them a gentle, inviting glow. The smooth, rounded edges of the fingers and palms contribute to a feeling of joyous celebration or enthusiastic agreement. This versatile emoji is commonly used to express excitement, praise, or a strong sense of affirmation.
